get.description: - Supports pagination via page parameter. 200 response items per page. - Not providing page will return items for page 1.

Use this method to get all the end of day reference codes. - Supports pagination via page parameter. 200 response items per page. - Not providing page will return items for page 1. Reference codes are convenient way of storing the reference of an entity from an another system that is related to an EposNow entity. Reference code methods always deal with the Reference codes registered with the authorizing token.

post.description:
Use this method to create EndOfDayReferenceCodes.
            - This method supports only full updates, you must supply the full object model when updating. If you do not provide required parameters the operation could fail,
            optional parameters that are not provided will be set to their default value.
            - Reference codes are convenient way of storing the reference of an entity from an another system that is related to an EposNow entity. 
            - Reference codes are only registered against your Auth Token.

delete.description: Use this method to delete ClockingReferenceCodes.

get.description: Use this method to get a end of day reference code.

put.description:
Use this method to update EndOfDayReferenceCodes.
            - Reference codes are convenient way of storing the reference of an entity from an another system that is related to an EposNow entity. 
            - Reference codes are only registered against your Auth Token.

Use this method to get all transactions - Supports pagination via page parameter. 200 response items per page. - Not providing page will return items for page 1.

get.description: Use this method to get all transactions ordered by date descending - Supports pagination via page parameter. 200 response items per page. - Not providing page will return items for page 1.
Use this method to get all transaction between 2 dates. - Supports pagination via page parameter. 200 response items per page. - Not providing page will return items for page 1.

Use this method to get all transactions for a table. - Supports pagination via page parameter. 200 response items per page. - Not providing page will return items for page 1. - Filter by statusId with status parameter. - Sort by date and time with dateTimeOrder. Possible values are asc and desc. If no value was passed or it was incorrect then transactions will be sorted by ID.

delete.description: Use this method to delete transactions.

Use this method to get all the transaction reference codes. - Supports pagination via page parameter. 200 response items per page. - Not providing page will return items for page 1. Reference codes are convenient way of storing the reference of an entity from an another system that is related to an EposNow entity. Reference code methods always deal with the Reference codes registered with the authorizing token.

Basic.description:
The Epos Now API uses Location specific API keys to authenticate requests. You can view and manage your API keys from the Epos Now Back Office under the API Device located in the App Store.

Make sure to read the documentation for each endpoint as some APIs are location specific, meaning that endpoints will only return information specific to the Location the API Device is associated with.

All API requests must be made over HTTPS. Requests made over plain HTTP will fail. API requests without authentication will also fail.

Epos Now APIs use Basic access authentication. When authenticating construct your key as follows - **Basic {{API_KEY}}**.
Basic.name: Authorization
